gcci.text: The average H100 price of $3.21/hr underscores persistent chip scarcity that constrains supply chain flexibility and raises capex breakeven hurdles for new GPU builds.

gtpi.text: An average input price of $1.56/1M tokens is aggressively competitive and likely to trigger API price wars, forcing providers to differentiate on model quality and throughput efficiency.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load highlights rising grid strain and favors accelerated nuclear and low‑carbon baseload adoption to stabilize AI data center power draw.

aipi.text: H100 at $3.21/hr and tokens at $1.56/1M point to an efficiency race amid compressed margins, keeping macro sentiment cautious about bubble risks despite strong growth.
